alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 17 at 7:27AM EDT until March 17 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Johnston County in central North Carolina... Central Wake County in central North Carolina... * Until 1030 AM EDT. * At 727 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Atlantic Ave in Raleigh. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and gauge reports. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Smithfield, Wake Forest, Garner, Clayton, Zebulon, Knightdale, Selma, Wendell, Rolesville, Lake Benson, Flowers, Lake Wheeler, Coats Crossroads, William B Umstead State Park and Falls Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
